intro: Gustavia macarenensis subsp. macarenensis, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Caribbean and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
